result.execSummary:
The defendant Kar-Preed Shad-Lee Wells was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Carry Concealed Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.23(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Huber privileges under Sec. 303.08 Wis. Stats. to apply for work and child care.  With credit for 3 days.

miscConds.notes:
Pay costs, surcharges, assessments, supervision and DNA fees out of bail on deposit, if any, with the balance, if any, prior to probation ending. Failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment with tax intercept.
Defendant required to provide a biological specimen (DNA) to the State Crime Lab for testing.

Defendant shall not be in possession of any firearms or weapons unless approved by the agent.
Court ordered the firearm to be forfeited to the State of Wisconsin
No new law violations reaching the level of a probable cause finding
Court will consider expungement if defendant successfully completes all conditions of probation with no new law violations reaching the level of a probable cause finding

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kar-Preed Shad-Lee Wells

defendant.name: Wells, Kar-Preed Shad-Lee
defendant.address: 7425 W. Silver Spring Drive, Milwaukee, WI 53218

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: BAIL REFUND
3/14/16 bail refund notice mailed to surety.
Court will consider expungement if defendant successfully completes all conditions of probation with no new law violations reaching the level of a probable cause finding
State's AMENDED Witness List received and filed with court.
State's Motion in Limine received and filed with the court.

Statements made as to Sentencing by both counsel and Defendant. Additional statement made by the Defendant's father.

COURT SENTENCED THE Defendant to serve 90 DAYS in the House of Correction with credit for 3 days time served.  Huber privileges under Sec.303.08 Wis. Stats. to apply for work and child care.  

Court IMPOSED AND STAYED the sentence and placed Defendant on Probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 1 YEAR with the following condition:
*  No new law violations reaching the level of a probable cause finding.
*  Cooperate with agent.
*  Pay costs, surcharges, assessments, supervision, and DNA fees out of bail on deposit, if any, with the balance, if any, prior to probation ending.  Failure to pay shall result in a Civil Judgment with tax intercept.
*  Defendant required to provide a biological specimen (DNA) to the State Crime Lab for testing.
*  Defendant shall not be in possession of any firearms or weapons unless approved by the agent.

Court ordered the firearm to be forfeited to the State of Wisconsin.

Court will consider expungement if Defendant successfully completes all conditions of probation with no new law violations reaching the level of a probable cause finding.

Defendant Kar-Preed Shad-Lee Wells in court with attorney Danielle Louise Shelton.  Margaret Anne Kunisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Defendant waived rights and pled GUILTY.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire received and filed.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Parties stipulate to the facts of the complaint as a basis for a guilty plea.  Court found the Defendant guilty as charged in the complaint.  Judgment of Conviction entered.  Parties are prepared to proceed with Sentencing.

Defendant Kar-Preed Shad-Lee Wells in court with attorney Danielle L. Shelton.  James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Case set for Jury Trial. Due to this court being in trial, court ordered case adjourned for a Jury Trial. Case adjourned to branch 45.  Jury trial scheduled for March 7, 2016 at 08:30 am.
State's Requested Jury Instructions received and filed with court.
Received and filed with court.

Defendant Kar-Preed Shad-Lee Wells in court with attorney Danielle L. Shelton.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Final pretrial held.  Case remains scheduled for jury trial on 10-19-2015 in Branch  45.

Defendant Kar-Preed Shad-Lee Wells in court with attorney Danielle L. Shelton.  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defense requests to scheduled case for final pretrial and jury trial.  Parties are notified that effective August 3, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to Judge Lindsey Grady, Branch 23 in Courthouse room 515.  Final pre-trial scheduled for October 8, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for October 19, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Kar-Preed Shad-Lee Wells in court with attorney Danielle L. Shelton.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defense counsel requests another status conference date.  Court orders case adjourned to Branch 45.  Status conference scheduled for July 7, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Kar-Preed Shad-Lee Wells in court with attorney Danielle L. Shelton.  Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defense counsel requests a status date. Court orders case adjourned to Branch 46.  Status conference scheduled for June 10, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Cash bail that was previously posted to remain.
Court ordered no possession or use of any dangerous weapons or firearms.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Kar-Preed Shad-Lee Wells in court.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Reserve Judge, Branch 46.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.   Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  Defendant IS Public Defender eligible.  Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  The case is adjourned to Br. 46 for a Pretrial Conference.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 22, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

$500 cash bail posted
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 4-7-2015 at 1:30pm
